net.vivialconnect.model.message

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.vivialconnect.model.VivialConnectResource
      • net.vivialconnect.model.message.Message
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Message
extends VivialConnectResource
    Sending messages is the main feature provide by the Vivial Connect API. This class represents the Message entity and provide all the properties and methods needed for send and retrieve messages from your account.

    The API uses two types of messages:

    • SMS messages - basic text messages
    • MMS messages - text messages with media attachments

    For more info, visit: https://dashboard.vivialconnect.net/docs/api/messages.html

    See Also:
    Number, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public Message send()
             throws ForbiddenAccessException,
                    BadRequestException,
                    UnauthorizedAccessException,
                    ServerErrorException,
                    ApiRequestException
        Sends this text message using the API.

        If the connector_id property is set, the from_number property will be ignored.

        In order to send an MMS, be sure to add media attachments to this message using the addMediaUrl(String) and setMediaUrls(List) methods.

        Returns:
        the message that was just sent
        Throws:
        ForbiddenAccessException - if the user does not have permission to the API resource
        BadRequestException - if the request params and/or payload are not valid
        UnauthorizedAccessException - if any of the auth properties account ID, API Key and/or API secret are not valid
        ServerErrorException - if the server is unable to process the request
        ApiRequestException - if an API error occurs
        See Also:
        setBody(String), setFromNumber(String), setToNumber(String), setConnectorId(int), addMediaUrl(String), setMediaUrls(List)

                                     UnauthorizedAccessException,

        UnauthorizedAccessException - if any of the auth properties account ID, API Key and/or API secret are not valid
        ServerErrorException - if the server is unable to process the request
        ApiRequestException - if an API error occurs
        See Also:
        getMessages(), getMessages(Map)

                                 throws ForbiddenAccessException,
                                        BadRequestException,
                                        UnauthorizedAccessException,
                                        ServerErrorException,
                                        ApiRequestException
        Gets all the messages associated with the current account. If there are none, this method will return an empty { @link List }
        Returns:

        Throws:
        ForbiddenAccessException - if the user does not have permission to the API resource
        BadRequestException - if the request params and/or payload are not valid
        UnauthorizedAccessException - if any of the auth properties account ID, API Key and/or API secret are not valid
        ServerErrorException - if the server is unable to process the request
        ApiRequestException - if an API error occurs
        See Also:

      • getMessages

        public static List<Message> getMessages(Map<String,String> queryParameters)
                                 throws ForbiddenAccessException,
                                        BadRequestException,
                                        UnauthorizedAccessException,
                                        ServerErrorException,
                                        ApiRequestException
        Lists and filters the messages associated with the current account. If there are none, the method will return an empty List
        Parameters:
        queryParameters - a map of String key-value pairs used to filter results, possible values are:

        page â€“ Page number within the returned list of text messages. Default value: 1.

        limit â€“ Number of results to return per page. Default value: 50. Maximum value: 150.

        Returns:
        a list of messages
        Throws:
        ForbiddenAccessException - if the user does not have permission to the API resource
        BadRequestException - if the request params and/or payload are not valid
        UnauthorizedAccessException - if any of the auth properties account ID, API Key and/or API secret are not valid
        ServerErrorException - if the server is unable to process the request
        ApiRequestException - if an API error occurs
        See Also:
        getMessages(), getMessageById(int)

      • setToNumber

        public void setToNumber(String toNumber)
        Set the destination phone number to where the text message will be sent.
        Parameters:
        toNumber - - Destination phone number for the text message in E.164 format (+country code +phone number)

      • getFromNumber

        public String getFromNumber()
        One of the following:

        For inbound messages, the external phone number that sent the text message. Uses E.164 format (+country code +phone number). For US, the format will be +1xxxyyyzzzz

        For outbound messages, the associated phone number in your account that sent the text message

        Returns:
        from number value

      • setFromNumber

        public void setFromNumber(String fromNumber)
        Sets the origin phone number for the text message.
        Parameters:
        fromNumber - Origination of the text message using the associated phone number you specify in E.164 format (+country code +phone number). It must match an associated number you have purchased for your account.

      • getConnectorId

        public int getConnectorId()
        The id of the Connector to use to send the message with.
        Returns:
        connector ID value

      • setConnectorId

        public void setConnectorId(int connectorId)
        Set the connector ID for send the message. The connector ID must exists in the API.
        Parameters:
        connectorId - connector ID value.

      • getSent

        public Date getSent()
        One of the following in ISO 8601 format:

        For inbound messages, the UTC timestamp the text message was received

        For outbound messages, the UTC timestamp the text message was sent

        Returns:
        Sent date value
